question.title: What is a common mechanism that can contribute to coma in adults and children?
question.description: A person is in a non-traumatic coma. What could be the cause?

option_a.title: Severe infection
option_a.description: A severe infection can cause a coma by overwhelming the body's immune system and disrupting brain function.

option_b.title: Severe allergic reaction
option_b.description: A severe allergic reaction can cause a coma by releasing large amounts of histamine and other chemicals that can affect the brain.

option_c.title: Hypoxia
option_c.description: Hypoxia is a condition in which the body, or a region of the body, is deprived of adequate oxygen supply.

option_d.title: Toxins in the blood
option_d.description: Toxins in the blood can cause a coma by disrupting normal brain function and leading to brain damage.
